result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CM259.
Recorded.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Defendant is in Oak Hill Correctional.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional Institution with counsel SPD William Poss present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.

Pre-trial conference at 01-27-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-15-2016 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional Institution with counsel SPD William Poss present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.  Defense waives reading of the complaints; defendant stands mute and requests pretrial and status conference dates.  Court entered not guilty plea, set pretrial for 1-27-16 at 10:00 and status conference for 2-15-16 at 3:00 with no appearance necessary by defendant.
Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional.  Defendant sent a request to his social worker to be able to contact SPD.  He never got a response from the social worker.  Attorney Sebion will set up a telephone conference.  AIA set for 12/14/15 at 11:45 am.
Talked to HZ in J.O. and the 12-3 date will not work for a VTC.  She will get back to me.
No appearance by defendant.  ADA Inlow - he is in the prison system.  Court scheduled VTC hearing on 12-3-15 at 10:00 for STC and/or Waiver of Counsel.
Mailed a waiver of counsel form to defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher B Anderson
Current: PO Box 140, C/O Oakhill Correctional Institution, Oregon, WI 53575   (Effective: 10-07-2015)
Prior: Doc #00443860 C/o Oakhill Correctional Institution, Oregon, WI 53575
Defendant appeared by video from Oak Hill Correctional without any counsel present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.

Defendant appears by video from Oak Hill Correctional with no counsel present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant admits to receipt of both complaints.  Judge reviews charges and potential penalties of both cases.  Defendant understands charges/penalties.  He has not contacted SPD or attorney.  SPD Poss present in the courtroom and states the defendant should be able to talk to prison social worker and they can arrange a phone call to SPDO.  Court set for STC on 11-23-15 at 1:30.  Will not be contacting defendant by VTC.  Hopefully a public defender is appointed by then.  Clerk will mail defendant a waiver of attorney form and will proceed from there.  If he waives his right to an attorney then cases will then be set for a VTC date.
